lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/kuromi.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run kuromi.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* The main class of Duke where the application is instantiated through this class. A Duke object
* has three attributes: Storage, TaskList, and Ui that is needed to run the application.
/** Access to the storage of tasks in hard disk **/
* Main constructor (for invocation by main method).
* Get stored data from previous session.
* @param filePath The file path to the file stored with data from previous Duke session.
* Runs Duke application to interact with the user.
* When Duke is created, the compilation starts from the main method.
* @param args The command line arguments for the application.
* Custom exception to throw if there is a bug within the application.
* Main constructor (for invocation by other classes to throw the exception.
* Parser class parses the full user's input to understand what command the user has typed.
* Split the input string from the user to interpret what command is typed by the user.
* Returns a Command that is meant by the user.
* If the input from the user is incomplete, it will throw an error.
* @param inp Full input from the user.
* @param ui UI of the current session.
* @param tasks Tasks for the current session.
* @throws KuromiException If user input is incomplete.
public static Command parse(String inp, Ui ui, TaskList tasks) throws KuromiException {
throw new KuromiException("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
throw new KuromiException("☹ OOPS!!! The keyword cannot be empty.");
throw new KuromiException("☹ OOPS!!! The index does not exist.");
throw new KuromiException("☹ OOPS!!! The index does not exist.");
throw new KuromiException("☹ OOPS!!! The index does not exist.");
throw new KuromiException("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new KuromiException("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
for (int i = counter; i < temp.length; i++) {
throw new KuromiException("☹ OOPS!!! The deadline of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new KuromiException("☹ OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.");
for (int i = counter2; i < temp.length; i++) {
throw new KuromiException("☹ OOPS!!! The start date of a deadline cannot be empty.");
for (int i = counter3; i < temp.length; i++) {
cur = new AddCommand(new Event(desc3, by2, from));
throw new KuromiException("☹ OOPS!!! The end date of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new KuromiException("☹ OOPS!!! The index cannot be empty.");
* Read data from the file in the hard disk and store data to the same file if there are any updates to the
/** The file path to the file stored with data from previous Duke session. **/
* Main constructor (for invocation by classes that require updating data to the storage and taking data
* @param filePath The file path to the file stored with data from previous Duke session.
* Loads the data that is stored in the file.
* @return ArrayList of Tasks from the file.
* Updates the data in the file to match with the current TaskList.
* Deals with interactions with the user (e.g. reading inputs, showing outputs).
* Show errors occurred to the user.
* @param msg Error message to be shown.
* Show error if cannot load the file that is in the hard disk.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Kuromi\nWhat can I do for you?");
* Show a message to the user.
* Command to add a task to the TaskList.
* Add the task into the task list.
* Ask the UI to print the output.
* @param ui UI of the application to interact with users.
* @param storage Storage to update when there is an update with the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
String msg = "Got it. I've added this task:\n";
msg += "Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.";
* Command meant by the user input.
* Abstract class that will be inherited by the various command types.
* Has an abstract method execute to execute various commands.
/** Determines whether the program should be ended **/
* @param ui UI of the application to interact with users.
* @param storage Storage to update when there is an update with the task list.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Determines whether the program should be terminated.
* @return Boolean value if true then exit, if false then not exit.
* An enum class to easily enumerate between Command Types entered by the user.
* Command to delete a task from the task list.
/** Index of the task to be deleted in the task list. **/
* @param idx Index of the task to be deleted.
* Delete task from the task list.
* Ask UI to print the output.
* @param ui UI of the application to interact with users.
* @param storage Storage to update when there is an update with the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
String msg = "Noted. I've removed this task:\n";
msg += "Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.";
* Command to exit the current session.
* @param ui UI of the application to interact with users.
* @param storage Storage to update when there is an update with the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
String msg = "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
* Command to find the tasks that contains the keyword from the user's input.
* @param keyword The keyword to be searched.
* Find the tasks that contain the keyword input from the user.
* Ask UI to show the output.
* @param ui UI of the application to interact with users.
* @param storage Storage to update when there is an update with the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
String msg = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n";
* Command to list the tasks in the task list.
* Ask UI to list the tasks.
* @param ui UI of the application to interact with users.
* @param storage Storage to update when there is an update with the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
String msg = "Got it. I've added this task:\n";
msg += "Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.";
/** Index of the task to be marked **/
* @param idx Index of the task to be marked.
* Mark the task as done in the task list.
* @param ui UI of the application to interact with users.
* @param storage Storage to update when there is an update with the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
String msg = "Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n";
/** Index of the task to be unmarked. **/
* @param idx Index of the task to be unmarked.
* Mark the task as not done.
* Ask UI to print the ouput.
* @param ui UI of the application to interact with users.
* @param storage Storage to update when there is an update with the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
String msg = "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n";

* Parent class of Todo, Deadline, and Event.
* Contains attributes and methods that a task should have.

return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
